title: Classic Pub Style Nachos Recipe
description: Nachos baked with bubbling Cheddar cheese and fresh tomato salsa make a bright and colorful snack for a party or watching the game.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Cheese Nachos Recipes Classic Pub Style Nachos 4.5 (28) 22 Reviews 10 Photos I got this recipe from summer camp, and when I made them at home, my whole family was impressed. Layers of tortilla chips and salsa with the works on the side - tastes just like the nachos they serve at restaurants. Perfect for a party! Submitted by sweets Updated on February 27, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¼ cup chopped red onion 4 tomatoes, seeded and finely chopped ½ cup chopped fresh parsley ¼ cup olive oil 1 lime, juiced 1 pinch salt and black pepper (Optional) 1 (8 ounce) package tortilla chips 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided ½ cup sour cream (Optional) ½ cup guacamole (Optional) Directions Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix together the onion, tomatoes, parsley, olive oil, lime juice, salt and pepper in a bowl. Spread tortilla chips in a single layer onto a baking sheet, and spoon about 1 teaspoon of the tomato salsa onto each chip. Spread 1 cup of Cheddar cheese over the nachos, top the chips with another teaspoon or so of salsa, and top with the remaining 1 cup of cheese. Bake the nachos in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling, about 5 minutes. Serve hot with sour cream, guacamole, and any remaining salsa on the side for dipping the chips. I Made It Print 65 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Classic Pub Style Nachos 01 of 10 Photo by  SoupLovingNicole 02 of 10 Photo by  NiftyCake7105 06/21/2024 A keeper! Absolutely fabulous with added guacamole and sour cream and thinly sliced jalapeño peppers.substituted cilantro rather than parsleyServed with bowls of Chilli 03 of 10 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 02/06/2024 Made as written and these were pretty good but I can't help but point out the obvious. Unless you are one of those people who think cilantro tastes like soap, cilantro would be a better choice for this rather than parsley. Recipe is simple and one I would make again but I'd def use cilantro. 04 of 10 Photo by  magswlburn 11/18/2018 Love this dish. I add cilantro and green onions to it. 05 of 10 Photo by  Casaundra Blackmon 03/09/2016 06 of 10 Photo by  rkw83 03/08/2015 Fun meal! Very great Nachos for people that do not like spicy food (My Wife). I swapped out the red onion for green. Really cheap and easy to make. 07 of 10 Photo by  Seattle2Sydney 02/02/2013 08 of 10 Photo by  Roxanne Douglas Roxy 12/02/2011 I left out the olive oil since I used prepared salsa, which made chips soggy so I will only be using salsa for dipping or topping after baking chips! I modified this by adding orange bell pepper and using a shredded mexican cheese blend, green onions and only a few tablespoons of parsley. Thanks for a simple yet great tasting meatless nacho recipe! 09 of 10 Photo by  mommyluvs2cook 11/02/2011 Yummy and simple! I topped the nachos with some chopped green onion and fresh cilantro. Thanks! 10 of 10 Photo by  sweets 04/25/2011 1 You’ll Also Love Aaron's Famous Vegetarian Nachos 14 Ratings Popcorn Nachos 35 Ratings Italian Nachos Restaurant-Style 52 Ratings Jen's Nachos 27 Ratings Steven's Baked Nachos 44 Ratings Restaurant-Style Chicken Nachos 611 Ratings Shrimp and Jalapeno Nachos 19 Ratings Taco Nachos 33 Ratings Spicy Lentil Nachos 39 Ratings Super Deluxe Steak Nachos 20 Ratings Zucchini Chip Nachos Baked BBQ Pulled Pork Nachos 2 Ratings Super Nachos 166 Ratings Over the Top Nachos 198 Ratings Reuben Nachos for Two 1 Rating Veggie Nachos 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Spread 1 cup of Cheddar cheese over the nachos, top the chips with another teaspoon or so of salsa, and top with the remaining 1 cup of cheese.;Bake the nachos in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling, about 5 minutes. Serve hot with sour cream, guacamole, and any remaining salsa on the side for dipping the chips.
